requirements.summary: Ensure all modal dialogs, dropdown menus, popovers, tooltips, and overlay components have fully opaque backgrounds for legibility
acceptanceCriteria: All modal dialogs (e.g. AddEmployeeModal, EditEmployeeModal, AddShiftModal, ShiftDetailModal, AddTrainingModal, EditTrainingModal, AssignBadgeModal, AddDocumentModal, EditDocumentModal, etc.) render with a fully opaque background and are readable over any page content.
All dropdown menus, popovers, and select option lists render with a fully opaque background.
No popup or overlay element has a semi-transparent or transparent background that allows underlying page content to bleed through and obscure the popup's own content.
The fix is applied globally (e.g. via CSS variables or Tailwind utility classes in index.css or the relevant component styles) so all current and future overlays benefit.
Overlays still display their backdrop/scrim (dimming the page behind them) correctly â€” only the popup panel itself must be opaque.

file_operations.description: Add global CSS rules to ensure all shadcn/ui Dialog, Popover, DropdownMenu, Select, and Tooltip components have fully opaque backgrounds. Target the relevant shadcn component classes (e.g., .DialogContent, .PopoverContent, .DropdownMenuContent, .SelectContent, .TooltipContent) and set explicit background-color values using the existing CSS custom properties (--background, --popover, --card) to ensure opacity is 1.0. Preserve the existing backdrop/scrim opacity for dimming effects. Do not alter the red/white/black escape-room color palette.
